## Portfolio Variance and Standard Deviation Calculation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(202) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) w <- runif(1, 0, 1) sd1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 15, sd = 3) sd2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 25, sd = 5) corr <- runif(1, -0.2, 0.8) # calculate variance and standard deviation var_port <- (w * sd1)^2 + ((1 - w) * sd2)^2 + 2 * w * (1 - w) * sd1 * sd2 * corr sd_port <- sqrt(var_port) ``` ::: You invest **12.89%** of your funds in Asset A (volatility = **16.32%**) and **87.11%** in Asset B (volatility = **20.86%**). The correlation between the two assets is **0.58**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Portfolio variance = w²×sd₁² + (1−w)²×sd₂² + 2×w×(1−w)×sd₁×sd₂×ρ = **379.09**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Portfolio standard deviation = √(variance) = **19.47**%.
:::
